title: Calories in a Green Apple
meta_description: Discover calories in green apple, including full nutrition breakdown per medium fruit, macros, fiber, and quick variations for your diet.
assumptions: Medium green apple (~182 g with skin), raw, unpeeled; Granny Smith variety typical for green apples.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by apple size, variety, ripeness, and growing conditions. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium green apple provides ~95 kcal, 4.4 g fiber, and 19 g natural sugars.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

faqs.q: How many calories in one green apple?
faqs.a: About 95 kcal for a medium green apple with skin.

faqs.q: Are green apples lower in calories than red?
faqs.a: Similar; both ~52 kcal per 100 g, varying slightly by variety and size.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in a green apple?
faqs.a: Around 4.4 g per medium apple, mostly soluble fiber for digestion.

faqs.q: Do green apples have more sugar than red?
faqs.a: No, comparable at ~19 g natural sugars per medium apple; green may taste tarter.

faqs.q: How does apple size affect calories?
faqs.a: Small (~125 g) ~65 kcal; large (~223 g) ~120 kcal. Weigh for accuracy.
